content: We have a VUG scheduled for tomorrow. I'm looking for someone to do a short demo/presentation on a contrib project you are working on. See Gitter.
@StPaulTim VUG's in just over an hour from now, right?
@BWPanda (Peter) you were correct. Sorry, I was not around. 20 minutes now

I have the Zoom meeting room open for today's Virtual User Group at: http://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings

Video Conferencing, Web Conferencing, Webinars, Screen Sharing
Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference room solution used around the world in board, conference, huddle, and training rooms, as well as executive offices and classrooms. Founded in 2011, Zoom helps businesses and organizations bring their teams together in a frictionless environment to get more done. Zoom is a publicly traded company headquartered in San Jose, CA.
Apologies in advance for my voice, got a bit of a cough...
We have 5 people in VUG so far, starting in a few minutes

Thanks to everyone who participated in the VUG. Feedback welcome and encouraged.

What topics do you want to talk about in the future.
Hadn't time to participate at the VUG today. Looking forward to watch it on Youtube. Btw, Youtube shows the video still as "live".
Yes, we had the "Live" issue with last weeks dev meetings as well, but eventually it went away (many hours later).
We definitely quit streaming and I am quite sure if you view the video, it will stop after 60 minutes. It's not still recording anything. (At least, that was the case last week).
Hmmm, I'm wondering if that's what made those couple of past meeting videos vanish (recording "live" for many hours, till a certain limit got reached, and then it failed to save). :shrug:
We don't know. Two weeks ago, we had a similar problem and our videos never showed up. Last week, we had the same problem, but both videos still worked fine.

Darn - I think I just lost the VUG video. I opened it in YouTube Studio and there was a button to "End Stream." Since the stream was over (but still listed as LIVE), I assumed that was a good button to hit. Now the video is totally gone.

Hoping that it is processing and will reappear.
OK, I found the video and added it to the VUG stream. For some reason, it says that it's 2 hours long, but is cut off after 40 minutes.
So, we my have lost the last part of the video. Link is here: YouTube - Virtual User Group: Contrib Modules
Weird video problems... Wonder if the problem is with Zoom or YouTube. In any case, maybe we could try using Jitsi next time...?

I think the problems are related to YouTube. Because, after a few hours I went back and the video is now loading and displaying just fine. Nothing missing, runs exactly was we would have expected

I now believe that it in the 1-2 hours after we finished the meeting, it was still processing (at Youtube) and thus acting a bit quirky.
